# Timeline of geopolitical changes (1900–1999)__disambig_1

This is a timeline of geopolitical changes around the world between 1900 and 1999. It includes dates of declarations of independence, changes in country name, changes of capital city or name, and changes in territory such as the annexation, cession, concession, occupation, or secession of land. Territorial conquests as a result of war are included on the timeline at the conclusion of military campaigns, but changes in the course of specific battles and day-to-day operations are generally not included. Changes in airspace and maritime territory are included only when they are subject to a dispute. Over 50% of the world's borders today were drawn as a result of British and French imperialism. The British and French drew the modern borders of the Middle East, 80% of the borders of Africa, in Asia after the independence of the British Raj and French Indochina and the borders of Europe after World War I as victors, as a result of the Paris treaties.
1900s
{|class=wikitable style="width:100%; text-align:center"
|-
!style="width:2em"|Year||style="width:4em"|Date||Event
|-
|rowspan=9 |1900||rowspan=2 |1 January||style=text-align:left |The Northern Nigeria Protectorate is established by the United Kingdom.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The Southern Nigeria Protectorate is established by the United Kingdom.
|-
|16 February||style=text-align:left |The United States of America takes control of American Samoa under the terms of the Tripartite Convention.
|-
|March||style=text-align:left |The First Republic of Acre capitulates and is reabsorbed by the Republic of Bolivia.
|-
|21 April||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom annexes the island of Niue, making it a British protectorate.
|-
|28 May||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom occupies the Orange Free State.
|-
|5 September||style=text-align:left |The colony of French Chad is established. Fort-Lamy is the capital.
|-
|November||style=text-align:left |Acre declares independence from Bolivia as the Second Republic of Acre. The movement is quickly suppressed and Acre remains part of Bolivia.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |The border between the Republic of the United States of Brazil and the French colony of Guyane (French Guiana) is defined by arbitration. The French troops that advanced to the margins of the Araguari River repair to the Oiapoque River.
|-
|rowspan=4 |1901||1 January||style=text-align:left |The Commonwealth of Australia is established by federation of the British colonies of New South Wales, Victoria, Queensland, South Australia, Western Australia and Tasmania. Melbourne was the de facto (but not de jure) seat of government from 1901 to 1927.
|-
|23 March||style=text-align:left |The First Philippine Republic dissolves.
|-
|11 June||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom transfers the Cook Islands and Niue to the Colony of New Zealand.
|-
|26 September||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom occupies the Ashanti Empire and makes it a crown colony.
|-
|rowspan=8 |1902||20 May||style=text-align:left |The Republic of Cuba gains independence from the United States of America. Havana is the capital.
|-
|31 May||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom creates the Orange River Colony from the Orange Free State and the Transvaal Colony from the South African Republic (Republic of Transvaal). Bloemfontein and Pretoria remains the respective capitals.
|-
|1 July||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom annexes Henderson Island.
|-
|10 July||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom annexes Oeno Island.
|-
|20 November||style=text-align:left |King Edward VII of Britain adjusts borders in the Cordillera of the Andes Boundary Case between Chile and Argentina.
|-
|19 December||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom annexes Ducie Island.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |The Zaria Emirate and the Abuja Emirate are annexed into the British Northern Nigeria Protectorate.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |German Kamerun annexes the Mandara Kingdom.
|-
|rowspan=10 |1903||27 January||style=text-align:left |The Third Republic of Acre declares its independence from Bolivia. The capital is Cidade do Acre.
|-
|23 February||style=text-align:left |Cuba leases Guantanamo Bay to the United States of America in perpetuity.
|-
|12 May||style=text-align:left |Mauritania becomes a protectorate of the French Republic. Saint-Louis is the capital.
|-
|29 July||style=text-align:left |The Adamawa Emirate is annexed into the British Northern Nigeria Protectorate and German Kamerun.
|-
|20 October||style=text-align:left |The Alaska boundary dispute is resolved between the United States of America and Canada.
|-
|3 November||style=text-align:left |The Republic of Panama secedes from the Republic of Colombia. Panama City is the capital.
|-
|11 November||style=text-align:left |The Republic of Bolivia and the Republic of the United States of Brazil sign the Treaty of Petrópolis. Bolivia receives land in Mato Grosso from Brazil, and Brazil absorbs the Republic of Acre.
|-
|18 November||style=text-align:left |The new Republic of Panama grants the United States of America control of the Panama Canal Zone. Balboa is the administrative center.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom secedes the Seychelles from the colony of Mauritius.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |After the Aceh War, the Sultanate of Aceh is annexed by the Kingdom of the Netherlands and becomes part of the Dutch East Indies.
|-
|rowspan=6 |1904||13 February||style=text-align:left |Following the Franco-Siamese Convention, the Kingdom of Siam concedes border territories to French Indochina in exchange for French-occupied Chantaburi.
|-
|4 May||style=text-align:left |The United States of America annexed the Panama Canal Zone.
|-
|4 October||style=text-align:left |The Franco-Spanish Convention of Paris acknowledges formal control of Saguia el-Hamra (later northern Spanish Sahara) by the Kingdom of Spain.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |The border between the Republic of the United States of Brazil and British Guiana is defined by arbitration. Approximately half of the disputed land goes to each side.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |French Dahomey is established. Porto-Novo is the capital.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |The Kingdom of Champasak is annexed by France and becomes part of the French protectorate of Laos.
|-
|rowspan=5 |1905||7 June||style=text-align:left |The Kingdom of Norway declares its independence from the United Kingdoms of Sweden and Norway through dissolution of the personal union with Kingdom of Sweden.
|-
|rowspan=2 |5 September||style=text-align:left |The Liaodong Peninsula and the Russian railway in south Manchuria are leased to the Empire of Japan following the Treaty of Portsmouth.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The Empire of Japan annexes Sakhalin Island south of 50° N following the Treaty of Portsmouth.
|-
|26 October||style=text-align:left |The Kingdom of Sweden recognizes the union dissolution and the independence of Kingdom of Norway.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom moves the capital of the East Africa Protectorate from Mombasa to Nairobi.
|-
|rowspan=3 |1906|| 1 May||style=text-align:left | The British Colony of Lagos and the Southern Nigeria Protectorate merge to form the Colony and Protectorate of Southern Nigeria.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |The French Republic divides its colony of French Congo into the colonies of Gabon and Middle Congo. Libreville remains the capital of Gabon. Brazzaville becomes the capital of Middle Congo.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom and France jointly administer the New Hebrides. Port Vila is the capital.
|-
|rowspan=6 |1907||23 March||style=text-align:left |The Kingdom of Siam concedes territory to French Indochina in exchange for Trat.
|-
|24 April||style=text-align:left |The border between the Republic of the United States of Brazil and the Republic of Colombia is defined by the Bogotá Treaty. Brazil gains lands on the margins of the Solimoes River at the area known as Cabeça de Cachorro ("The Dog's Head").
|-
|6 July||style=text-align:left |The British Central Africa Protectorate is renamed to Nyasaland Protectorate.
|-
|26 September||style=text-align:left |New Zealand becomes a Dominion within the British Empire under the name Dominion of New Zealand. Wellington is the capital. The Dominion of Newfoundland is also declared the same day. St. John's is the capital.
|-
|16 November||style=text-align:left |Oklahoma is admitted to the Union as the 46th State of the United States.
|-
|17 December||style=text-align:left |Ugyen Wangchuck establishes the Kingdom of Bhutan. Punakha is the winter capital and Thimphu is the summer capital.
|-
|rowspan=3 |1908||5 October|| style="text-align:left" |The Kingdom of Bulgaria gains independence from the Ottoman Empire. Sofia is the capital.
|-
|6 October||style=text-align:left |Austria-Hungary formally annexes the Ottoman Vilayet of Bosnia (under de facto Austro-Hungarian rule since the Treaty of Berlin 1878) as the Condominium of Bosnia and Herzegovina (causing the Bosnian crisis).
|-
|15 November||style=text-align:left |King Leopold II of Belgium sells his private Congo Free State to the Kingdom of Belgium. The colony is renamed the Belgian Congo.
|-
|1909||9 July||style=text-align:left |The Kingdom of Siam transfers its southernmost provinces to British Malaya in the Anglo-Siamese Treaty of 1909.
|}
1910s
{|class=wikitable style="width:100%; text-align:center"
|-
!style="width:2em"|Year||style="width:4em"|Date||Event
|-
|rowspan=7 |1910||15 January||style=text-align:left |The French Republic creates French Equatorial Africa from its colonies of Gabon, Middle Congo, and Oubangui-Chari. Libreville and Bangui yield to Brazzaville as the capital.
|-
|29 March||style=text-align:left |23 bancos are annexed by Mexico from the United States and 34 bancos are annexed by the United States of America from Mexico with the first application of the Banco Convention of 1905.
|-
|31 May||style=text-align:left |The Cape Colony, the Colony of Natal, the Transvaal, and the Orange River Colony unite as the Union of South Africa, which is established as a Dominion under the terms of the South Africa Act 1909.
|-
|20 August||style=text-align:left |Canada rescinds its claim to Pope's Folly Island in a treaty with the United States of America.
|-
|22 August||style=text-align:left |The Korean Empire capitulates and is annexed by the Empire of Japan.
|-
|5 October||style=text-align:left |The first Portuguese Republic supersedes the Kingdom of Portugal.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |The Kasanje Kingdom is annexed to Portuguese Angola.
|-
|rowspan=4 |1911||17 August||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom unites Barotziland–North-Western Rhodesia and North-Eastern Rhodesia to form Northern Rhodesia.
|-
|4 November||style=text-align:left |In the Morocco–Congo Treaty, Germany acquires the Neukamerun region from France in exchange for abandoning German claims in Morocco.
|-
|29 December||style=text-align:left |The Bogd Khanate of Mongolia declares independence from the Qing dynasty of China. Niislel Khüree is the capital.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |The capital of British India is moved from Calcutta to New Delhi.
|-
|rowspan=8 |1912||1 January||style=text-align:left |The Republic of China overthrows the Qing dynasty of China in the Xinhai Revolution. Nanking is the provisional capital.
|-
|6 January||style=text-align:left |New Mexico is admitted to the Union as the 47th State of the United States.
|-
|14 February||style=text-align:left |Arizona is admitted to the Union as the 48th State of the United States.
|-
|30 March||style=text-align:left |The Treaty of Fez formally re-establishes Morocco as a French Protectorate.
|-
|7 November||style=text-align:left |Mexico annexes 20 bancos from the United States and the United States of America annexes 11 bancos from Mexico.
|-
|27 November||style=text-align:left |The Treaty Between France and Spain Regarding Morocco assigns the northern and southern strips of Morocco to Spain.
|-
|28 November||style=text-align:left |Albania declares its independence from the Ottoman Empire. Tirana is the capital.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |The Wadai Empire is disestablished and annexed into French Chad.
|-
|rowspan=4 |1913||13 February||style=text-align:left |Tibet declares independence from the Republic of China.
|-
|May||style=text-align:left |The Imamate of Oman rebels against the Sultanate of Muscat and Oman. Nizwa becomes the capital after it is conquered on 5 June.
|-
|10 August||style=text-align:left |Following the First Balkan War, the Treaty of Bucharest is signed, by the terms of which:
*Bulgaria gains Western Thrace and the southern portions of what are now Blagoevgrad Province and Burgas Province.
*Romania gains Southern Dobruja.
*Serbia gains Kosovo, most of what is now the Republic of Northern Macedonia, and some new land to the west of its previous borders.
*Greece gains Epirus, West Macedonia, Central Macedonia, and most of the islands in the Aegean Sea that it did not control before the war.
*Albania gains southern, eastern, and northern lands that bring it to its current borders.
*Albania becomes officially independent, though large portions of its lands remain disputed.
*Montenegro gains most of what is now its Northern Region.
|-
|29 September||style=text-align:left |Following the Second Balkan War, the Treaty of Constantinople is signed, by the terms of which:
*The Ottoman Empire regains the portions of Eastern Thrace it lost in the First Balkan War.
*The Balkan League gains all Ottoman territory west of the line joining Enez and Kıyıköy; thus the Ottomans lose all their European territory, except for what is roughly the southeastern half of Turkey's present-day European territory.
|-
|rowspan=6 |1914||1 January||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom unites the Colony and Protectorate of Southern Nigeria and the Northern Nigeria Protectorate to form the Colony and Protectorate of Nigeria. Lagos is the capital.
|-
|7 March||style=text-align:left |Albania becomes the Principality of Albania.
|-
|17 April||style=text-align:left |Tannu Uriankhai is officially made a protectorate of the Russian Empire.
|-
|28 July||style=text-align:left |Following the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand, Austria-Hungary declares war on Serbia, precipitating the First World War.
|-
|1 September||style=text-align:left |The Russian Empire changes the name of its capital from Saint Petersburg to Petrograd.
|-
| ||style=text-align:left |The Kingdom of Kongo is annexed to Portuguese Angola.
|-
|rowspan=5 |1915||1 May||style=text-align:left |The Panama Canal Zone border is redefined between Panama and the United States of America resulting in slight territory changes.
|-
|27 May||style=text-align:left |The United States of America annexes some more land around the Rio Chagres mouth in the Panama Canal Zone due to the Hay–Bunau-Varilla Treaty.
|-
|18 October||style=text-align:left |The German Empire creates the Government General of Warsaw from the parts of Poland conquered by the Russian Empire.
|-
|8 December||style=text-align:left |The United States of America annexes a triangle of island between the Rio Chagres, Caribbean Sea and the Panama Canal Zone.
|-
|12 December||style=text-align:left |Hongxian proclaims the Empire of China. Beijing is the capital.
|-
|rowspan=2 |1916||22 March||style=text-align:left |The Empire of China is abolished.
|-
|5 November||style=text-align:left |Germany and Austria-Hungary proclaim the establishment of the Kingdom of Poland. Warsaw is the capital.
|-
|rowspan=11 |1917||15 March||style=text-align:left |The Provisional Government of Russia supersedes the Russian Empire in the wake of the February Revolution.
|-
|31 March||style=text-align:left |Under the Treaty of the Danish West Indies, the United States of America acquires the Danish West Indies (excluding Water Island) from the Kingdom of Denmark, renaming them the United States Virgin Islands.
|-
|12 April||style=text-align:left |The Autonomous Governorate of Estonia is created from the Governorate of Estonia and some of the Governorate of Livonia of the Russian Empire.
|-
|1 July||style=text-align:left |Xuantong is reinstalled as Emperor of China in an event now called the Manchu Restoration.
|-
|12 July||style=text-align:left |End of the Manchu Restoration in China.
|-
|14 September||style=text-align:left |The Russian Republic supersedes the Provisional Government of Russia.
|-
|7 November||style=text-align:left |The Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic supersedes the Russian Republic.
|-
|28 November||style=text-align:left |The Provincial Assembly of the Autonomous Governorate of Estonia declares itself to be the only legally elected and constituted authority in Estonia, de facto declaring sovereignty from the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic. The Provincial Assembly is thereafter forced underground by the Russian SFSR powers which continues to treat Estonia as an autonomous, but not sovereign governorate.
|-
|2 December||style=text-align:left |The Emirate of Chechenia declares its independence from the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic. Vedeno is the capital.
|-
|6 December||style=text-align:left |The Republic of Finland gains independence from the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic. Helsinki is the capital.
|-
|22 December||style=text-align:left |The Independent State of Flanders declares its independence from the Kingdom of Belgium. Brussels is the capital.
|-
| rowspan="42" |1918||22 January||style=text-align:left |The '''Ukrainian People's Republic gains independence from the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic'. Kiev is the capital.
|-
|3 January||style=text-align:left |After a plebiscite in Narva on 23 December 1917, the town, including its Ivangorod (Jaanilinn) district across the Narva River, is ceded from the Saint Petersburg Governorate to the Autonomous Governorate of Estonia.
|-
|16 February||style=text-align:left |The State of Lithuania declares its independence from the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic. Vilnius is named the capital despite occupation by the Kingdom of Poland.
|-
|24 February||style=text-align:left |The Republic of Estonia declares independence from the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic. Tallinn is the capital.
|-
|3 March||style=text-align:left |The Treaty of Brest-Litovsk creates many new states out of the western Russian Empire.
|-
|12 March||style=text-align:left |The Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic moves its capital from Petrograd to Moscow.
|-
|rowspan=2 |25 March||style=text-align:left |The Abkhazian Republic (Abkhazia) gains independence from the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic. Sukhumi is the capital.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The 'Belarusian People's Republic declares its independence from the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic. Minsk and Hrodna are named the joint capitals.
|-
|27 March||style=text-align:left |The Union of Bessarabia with Romania is proclaimed by the Treaty of Paris (1920).
|-
|19 April||style=text-align:left |The Transcaucasian Democratic Federative Republic declares independence from Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic and annexes the Abkhazian Republic (Abkhazia).
|-
|22 April||style=text-align:left |The Transcaucasian Democratic Federative Republic gains independence from the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic. Tbilisi is the capital.
|-
|11 May||style=text-align:left |The Mountainous Republic of the Northern Caucasus annexes the Emirate of Chechenia.
|-
|26 May||style=text-align:left |The Democratic Republic of Georgia secedes from the Transcaucasian Democratic Federative Republic. Tbilisi is the capital.
|-
|28 May||style=text-align:left |Armenia and the Azerbaijan Democratic Republic dissolve the Transcaucasian Democratic Federative Republic. Yerevan and Baku are the respective capitals.
|-
|30 May||style=text-align:left |Armenia changes its name to the Democratic Republic of Armenia.
|-
|9 July||style=text-align:left |The Kingdom of Lithuania supersedes the State of Lithuania.
|-
|10 July||style=text-align:left |The Russian Socialist Federative Soviet Republic supersedes the Soviet Russian Republic.
|-
|12 July||style=text-align:left |The United States of America annexes  of land at Punta Paitilla for the Panama Canal Zone.
|-
|25 July||style=text-align:left |The Kingdom of Belgium reabsorbs the Independent State of Flanders.
|-
|21 August||style=text-align:left |The United States of America annexes land between Rio Chagres and [http://mapcarta.com/19874742 Quebrada Majagual] for the Panama Canal Zone.
|-
|29 October||style=text-align:left |The State of Slovenes, Croats and Serbs proclaims independence from the Austro-Hungarian Empire. Zagreb is the capital.
|-
|31 October||style=text-align:left |The Kingdom of Hungary declares the monarchy abolished. Budapest is the capital.
|-
|rowspan=3 |1 November||style=text-align:left |The Mutawakkilite Kingdom of Yemen (North Yemen) gains independence from the Ottoman Empire'''. Sana'a becomes its capital.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The Banat Republic is proclaimed.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The short-lived '''West Ukrainian People's Republic is proclaimed.
|-
|2 November||style=text-align:left |The Republic of Lithuania supersedes the Kingdom of Lithuania.
|-
|10 November||style=text-align:left |The Republic of Alsace-Lorraine is proclaimed. Strasbourg is the capital.
|-
|12 November||style=text-align:left |The Republic of German-Austria is proclaimed. Vienna is the capital.
|-
|14 November||style=text-align:left |The Republic of Poland supersedes the Kingdom of Poland.
|-
|15 November||style=text-align:left |The Kingdom of Serbia invades the short-lived Banat Republic and divides it between the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes and Romania.
|-
|16 November||style=text-align:left |The Hungarian People's Republic supersedes the Kingdom of Hungary.
|-
|18 November||style=text-align:left |The Republic of Latvia gains independence from the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic. Riga is the capital.
|-
|22 November||style=text-align:left |France annexes the Republic of Alsace-Lorraine'.
|-
|25 November||style=text-align:left |The de facto province of Vojvodina votes to join with the Kingdom of Serbia.
|-
|rowspan=2 |28 November||style=text-align:left |The Kingdom of Serbia annexes the Kingdom of Montenegro.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The Union of Bukovina with Romania is proclaimed.
|-
|29 November||style=text-align:left |The Commune of the Working People of Estonia is established as a puppet state in Soviet Russian-occupied Estonia.
|-
|rowspan=3 |1 December||style=text-align:left |Iceland, a dependent territory of the Kingdom of Denmark with home rule, becomes the fully sovereign Kingdom of Iceland in personal union with Denmark. Reykjavík is the capital.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The State of Slovenes, Croats and Serbs and the Kingdom of Serbia unite to form the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes. Zagreb yields to Belgrade as the capital.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The Union of Transylvania with Romania is proclaimed.
|-
|11 December||style=text-align:left|The 'Slovak People's Republic''' is established.
|-
|29 December||style=text-align:left|The Slovak People's Republic is disestablished, merged into the First Czechoslovak Republic.
|-
| rowspan="30" |1919||1 January|| style="text-align:left" |The Socialist Soviet Republic of Byelorussia supersedes the Belarusian People's Republic. Minsk and Smolensk remain joint capitals.
|-
|8 January||style=text-align:left|The Hutsul Republic is established.
|-
|27 February||style=text-align:left |The Lithuanian-Belorussian Soviet Socialist Republic supersedes the Socialist Soviet Republic of Byelorussia. Vilnius is the capital.
|-
|rowspan=2 |1 March||style=text-align:left |The Oriental State of Uruguay changes its name to the Oriental Republic of Uruguay.
|-
|style=text-align:left |French West Africa is reorganized, with Upper Volta as a separate colony.
|-
|21 March||style=text-align:left |The Hungarian Soviet Republic supersedes the Hungarian People's Republic.
|-
|6 April||style=text-align:left |The Bavarian Soviet Republic supersedes the People's State of Bavaria.
|-
|19 April||style=text-align:left |Poland occupies Vilnius, which is disputed by the Lithuanians.
|-
|3 May||style=text-align:left |The Free State of Bavaria supersedes the Bavarian Soviet Republic.
|-
|rowspan=2 |6 May||style=text-align:left |The Kionga Triangle is assigned to Portugal as a mandate.
|-
|style=text-align:left |Kamerun and Togoland are assigned to France and the United Kingdom as mandates, respectively.
|-
|rowspan=5 |7 May||style=text-align:left |German New Guinea and the Bismarck Archipelago are assigned to Australia as a mandate.
|-
|style=text-align:left |German Southwest Africa is assigned to South Africa as a mandate under the name South West Africa.
|-
|style=text-align:left |German Samoa is assigned to New Zealand as a mandate under the name Territory of Western Samoa.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The German Northern Pacific Islands are assigned to Japan as the South Seas Mandate.
|-
|style=text-align:left |Nauru is assigned to the British Empire (eventually the United Kingdom, Australia, and New Zealand) as a mandate.
|-
|30 May||style=text-align:left |Ruanda and Urundi (minus Kisaka district) are assigned to Belgium as a mandate.
|-
|11 June||style=text-align:left|The Hutsul Republic is disestablished, incorporated into the First Czechoslovak Republic.
|-
|28 June||style=text-align:left |In the aftermath of World War I, the Treaty of Versailles and the Little Treaty of Versailles are signed, by the terms of which:
*Eupen-Malmedy and Neutral Moresnet are ceded to Belgium.
*Alsace-Lorraine is officially ceded to FranceFrance.
*The Second Polish Republic is established in place of the puppet Kingdom of Poland. Most of Posen and West Prussia are ceded to Poland by Germany.
*Memel and Saarland are put under international administration.
*Plebiscites are provided for in Schleswig and Upper Silesia.
*Danzig and the surrounding area are superseded by the Free City of Danzig, which is administered by the League of Nations.
|-
|10 July||style=text-align:left |France and the United Kingdom agree on a frontier between their mandates in the Cameroons.
|-
|2 August||style=text-align:left |The '''Hungarian People's Republic supersedes the Hungarian Soviet Republic.
|-
|rowspan=2 |8 August||style=text-align:left |Afghanistan declares its independence from the United Kingdom.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The Hungarian Republic''' supersedes the Hungarian People's Republic.
|-
|11 August||style=text-align:left |The German Reich supersedes the German Empire.
|-
|10 September||style=text-align:left |Austria signs the Treaty of Saint-Germain-en-Laye, by the terms of which:
*Eastern Galicia is ceded to PolandPoland.
*South Tyrol, Trentino, Trieste, and Istria are ceded to ItalyItaly.
*Romanian sovereignty over Bukovina is recognized (union declared on 28 November 1918).
*The independence of Poland, CzechoslovakiaCzechoslovakia, and the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes is recognized.
|-
|12 September||style=text-align:left |The Bonin–Pichon agreement transfers two desert strips from French control to Italian Libya.
|-
|18 September||style=text-align:left |The United States of America annexes the island of Largo Remo for the Panama Canal Zone.
|-
|25 September||style=text-align:left |Spitsbergen is awarded to Norway.
|-
|27 November||style=text-align:left |Bulgaria signs the Treaty of Neuilly-sur-Seine, by the terms of which:
*Western Thrace is ceded to the Entente.
*The Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes is recognized and a small amount of land along the western border is ceded to it.
*Dobruja is returned to the Kingdom of Romania.
|}
1920s
{|class=wikitable style="width:100%; text-align:center"
|-
!style="width:2em"|Year||style="width:4em"|Date||Event
|-
|rowspan=16 |1920||rowspan=2 |10 January||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom officially takes over administration of German East Africa and changes its name to Tanganyika.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The League of Nations is founded.
|-
|2 February||style=text-align:left |The Estonian War of Independence ends with the Treaty of Tartu, which awards areas around Ivangorod (Jaanilinn) and Pechory (Petseri) from Soviet Russia to Estonia.
|-
|29 February||style=text-align:left |The Kingdom of Hungary supersedes the Hungarian Republic.
|-
|6 April||style=text-align:left |The Far Eastern Republic is established. Chita becomes the capital.
|-
|26 April||style=text-align:left |The '''Khorezm People's Soviet Republic supersedes the Khanate of Khiva.
|-
|28 April||style=text-align:left |The Azerbaijani Soviet Socialist Republic supersedes the Azerbaijan Democratic Republic.
|-
|Late April||style=text-align:left |Western Thrace is granted to the Kingdom of Greece by the Triple Entente.
|-

|10 February||style=text-align:left |The Paris Peace Treaties are signed. These treaties allow the defeated Axis powers to resume their responsibilities as sovereign states in international affairs and to qualify for membership in the United Nations. Italy loses the colonies of Italian East Africa and Italian Libya, their concession in Tianjin, China, and recognises the independence of Albania. The Dodecanese Islands are granted to Greece, whilst Istria is granted to Yugoslavia. The Free Territory of Trieste is established. France gains small border territory from Italy. Finland is restored to its post-Winter War borders, and additionally cedes Petsamo Province to the Soviet Union. Hungary is returned to its 1938 borders, losing all territorial gains since before the First Vienna Award. In addition, it cedes the Bratislava bridgehead to Czechoslovakia. Romania is returned to its borders of 1 January 1941, compared to pre-war borders Bessarabia and northern Bukovina are ceded to the Soviet Union and Southern Dobruja is ceded to Bulgaria. The Second Vienna Award however is reversed, with northern Transylvania being returned to Romania. Bulgaria is returned to its borders just after the Treaty of Craiova in which it gained the aforementioned Southern Dobruja. They return their territories occupied from Greece and Yugoslavia.

| rowspan=2|2 December||style=text-align:left |The United Arab Emirates is established between six of the seven emirates of the former Trucial States: Abu Dhabi, Ajman, Dubai, Fujairah, Sharjah, and Umm Al Quwain. Abu Dhabi city becomes the capital.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The Emirate of Ras Al Khaimah temporarily becomes independent, as it rejects the terms of the agreement between the other former Trucial States. Ras Al Khaimah City remains the capital.
|-
|13 December||style=text-align:left |Australia changes the name of the Territory of Papua and New Guinea to Papua New Guinea.
|-
|16 December
|
* Secession of Pakistan's eastern wing
* Independence of Bangladesh is secured as Pakistani forces surrender, soon global powers would immediately recognize it the new nation. Bangladesh becomes a republic in the Commonwealth of Nations.
|-
| rowspan=9|1972 ||1 January||style=text-align:left |Following simultaneous referendums on 1 September 1971 in Egypt, in Libya, and in Syria, the Federation of Arab Republics is formed as a confederation working toward state unification.
|-
| rowspan=2|10 February||style=text-align:left |The Emirate of Ras Al Khaimah joins the United Arab Emirates. Ras Al Khaimah City yields to Abu Dhabi as the capital.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom formally incorporates Rockall as part of Scotland.
|-
|28 February||style=text-align:left |The Southern Sudan Autonomous Region is established in Sudan.
|-
|15 May||style=text-align:left |The United States transfers the Ryukyu Islands, including the Daitō Islands, back to Japan as Okinawa Prefecture.
|-
|20 May||style=text-align:left |Following a referendum, the Federal Republic of Cameroon changes its name to the United Republic of Cameroon.
|-
|22 May||style=text-align:left |Ceylon changes its name to the Free, Sovereign and Independent Republic of Sri Lanka and severs all ties to the British monarchy as a Commonwealth realm, but remains in the Commonwealth of Nations.
|-
|17 August||style=text-align:left |Indonesia changes the name of its capital from Djakarta to Jakarta.
|-
|1 September||style=text-align:left |The United States removes its claims over the Swan Islands, ending part of its territorial dispute with Honduras.
|-
| rowspan=14|1973 ||First Half||style=text-align:left |Libya invades the Aouzou Strip in northern Chad, formally annexing the region in 1975 and occupying it until 1994.
|-
| rowspan=3|1 January||style=text-align:left |Portugal reorganizes the Overseas Province of Angola as the State of Angola.
|-
|style=text-align:left |Portugal reorganizes the Overseas Province of Mozambique as the State of Mozambique.
|-
|style=text-align:left |Denmark, Ireland, and the United Kingdom join the European Communities.
|-
|29 March||style=text-align:left |The last U.S. combat troops are flown out of Tan Son Nhut Air Base, ending the eight-year United States occupation of South Vietnam.
|-
|24 April||style=text-align:left |The Gambia changes the name of its capital from Bathurst to Banjul.
|-
| rowspan=2|1 June||style=text-align:left |The Kingdom of Greece changes its name to the Hellenic Republic.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom changes the name of the Crown Colony of British Honduras to the Crown Colony of Belize.
|-
|10 July||style=text-align:left |The Commonwealth of the Bahama Islands gains independence from the United Kingdom as the Commonwealth of The Bahamas. Nassau remains the capital.
|-
|17 July||style=text-align:left |Following a coup, the Republic of Afghanistan supersedes the Kingdom of Afghanistan. Kabul remains the capital.
|-
|24 September||style=text-align:left |PAIGC rebels declare the independence of Portuguese Guinea from Portugal as the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. Madina do Boe is the de facto capital.
|-
|25 October||style=text-align:left |A ceasefire is imposed in the Yom Kippur War, with Israel occupying 1600 km2 of Egyptian and 500 km2 of Syrian territory conquered since 6 October.
|-
|2 November||style=text-align:left |The UN General Assembly recognizes the independence of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, the first sub-Saharan African state to unilaterally declare independence without the consent of its colonial power (Portugal).
|-
|19 November||style=text-align:left |Uruguay relinquishes its claim to Martín García Island to Argentina.
|-
| rowspan=17|1974 ||3 January||style=text-align:left |The Union of Burma changes its name to the Socialist Republic of the Union of Burma.
|-
|20 January||style=text-align:left |China conquers the contested Paracel Islands after a naval battle against South Vietnam.
|-
|7 February||style=text-align:left |The associated state of Grenada gains independence from the United Kingdom. St. George's remains the capital.
|-
|21 February||style=text-align:left |Israel completely withdraws from Egyptian territory west of the Suez Canal occupied in the Yom Kippur War, as part of the January Separation of Forces Agreement between the two states and the UN Security Council.
|-
|22 February||style=text-align:left |Pakistan recognizes the independence of Bangladesh, relinquishing its claims to the former East Pakistan.
|-
| 24 March||style=text-align:left |The Nation of Tanna declares independence from the Anglo–French New Hebrides Condominium.
|-
|26 June||style=text-align:left |Israel completely withdraws from Syrian territory occupied in the Yom Kippur War and 25 km2 occupied in the Six-Day War, implementing the May 1974 agreement creating a 235 km2 UNDOF buffer zone.
|-
|29 June||style=text-align:left |The Nation of Tanna is overthrown and reincorporated into the Anglo–French New Hebrides Condominium.
|-
|16 August||style=text-align:left |Turkey imposes a ceasefire after conquering 37% of Cyprus since 20 July. UN peacekeepers on the island since 1963 are deployed along the ceasefire line to create an expanded United Nations Buffer Zone in Cyprus.
|-
|21 August||style=text-align:left |Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates agree on a new mutual border, though the UAE subsequently disputes the Saudi interpretation of the new boundary line.
|-
|5 September||style=text-align:left |The Parliament of India passes a constitutional amendment incorporating the Kingdom of Sikkim as an "associate state".
|-
|10 September||style=text-align:left |Following an agreement to end the war on 26 August, Portugal dissolves Portuguese Guinea and recognizes the independence of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau. Bissau becomes the capital.
|-
|12 September||style=text-align:left |Following a Derg coup amidst popular unrest, the Provisional Military Government supersedes the Ethiopian Empire, though the monarchy is formally abolished only on 21 March 1975. Addis Ababa remains the capital.
|-
|1 October||style=text-align:left |The Autonomous Turkish Cypriot Administration is established as a nominally autonomous state in the Turkish–occupied territories of Cyprus. North Nicosia becomes the de facto capital.
|-
|19 October||style=text-align:left |Following a referendum, the status of Niue is upgraded to self-government in free association with New Zealand. Alofi remains the capital.
|-
|13 December||style=text-align:left |The State of Malta changes its name to the Republic of Malta and severs all ties to the British monarchy as a Commonwealth realm.
|-
|20 December||style=text-align:left |Following the proclamation of "Ethiopian socialism", the Derg Provisional Military Government begins using the name Provisional Military Government of Socialist Ethiopia.
|-
| rowspan=28|1975 ||1 January||style=text-align:left |Malawi moves its capital from Zomba to Lilongwe.
|-
|13 February||style=text-align:left |The Autonomous Turkish Cypriot Administration is reorganized as the Turkish Federated State of Cyprus, with the intention of forcing federation upon Cyprus. North Nicosia remains the capital.
|-
|9 April||style=text-align:left |India invades the Kingdom of Sikkim, organizing a referendum on abolishing the monarchy five days later.
|-
|17 April||style=text-align:left |Following the victory of the Khmer Rouge in the Cambodian Civil War, Kampuchea supersedes the Khmer Republic. Phnom Penh remains the capital.
|-
|30 April||style=text-align:left |Following the Fall of Saigon, the Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Republic of South Vietnam supersedes the Republic of Vietnam. Saigon remains the capital.
|-
|16 May||style=text-align:left |India officially annexes the Kingdom of Sikkim as the State of Sikkim. Gangtok yields to New Delhi as the capital.
|-
|22 June||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom changes the name of British Solomon Islands Protectorate to Solomon Islands.
|-
|25 June||style=text-align:left |In accordance with the Lusaka Accord, the State of Mozambique gains independence from Portugal as the '''People's Republic of Mozambique. Lourenço Marques remains the capital.
|-
|5 July||style=text-align:left |The Overseas Province of Cape Verde gains independence from Portugal as the Republic of Cape Verde. Praia remains the capital.
|-
| rowspan=2|6 July||style=text-align:left |Following a referendum in December 1974, the Territory of the Comoros unilaterally declares independence from France as the State of Comoros. Moroni remains the capital.
|-
|style=text-align:left |Due to its "no" vote in the December 1974 referendum, Mayotte separates from the Comoros''' upon the latter's independence and remains part of France, though its exact status is undefined. Dzaoudzi becomes the capital.
|-
|12 July||style=text-align:left |The Overseas Province of São Tomé and Príncipe gains independence from Portugal as the Democratic Republic of São Tomé and Príncipe. São Tomé remains the capital.
|-
|1 September||style=text-align:left |Two weeks before Papua New Guinea's independence, Bougainville Island declares independence from the territory and from Australia as the Republic of North Solomons. Arawa becomes the capital.
|-
|4 September||style=text-align:left |In a treaty with Egypt, Israel agrees to withdraw from western Sinai and create a United Nations Emergency Force buffer zone in the region.
|-
|16 September||style=text-align:left |Papua New Guinea gains independence from Australia as the Independent State of Papua New Guinea. Port Moresby remains the capital.
|-
|1 October||style=text-align:left |Following a referendum, the British Colony of Gilbert and Ellice Islands is de jure divided into the Colony of Gilbert Islands and the Colony of Tuvalu. Tarawa remains and Funafuti becomes their respective capitals.
|-
|11 November||style=text-align:left |In accordance with the Alvor Agreement, the State of Angola gains independence from Portugal as the '''People's Republic of Angola. Luanda remains the capital.
|-
|14 November||style=text-align:left |A week after Morocco organized the Green March into Spanish Sahara, Spain agrees to decolonize Western Sahara through a temporary tripartite administration with Mauritania and Morocco.
|-
|25 November||style=text-align:left |Suriname gains full independence from the Kingdom of the Netherlands as the Republic of Suriname. Paramaribo remains the capital.
|-
|28 November||style=text-align:left |The Fretilin party unilaterally declares the independence of Portuguese Timor as East Timor. Dili remains the capital. The UN continues to recognize Portugal as the legitimate administrative power until May 2002.
|-
|30 November||style=text-align:left |The Republic of Dahomey changes its name to the People's Republic of Benin.
|-
|2 December||style=text-align:left |Following the victory of the Pathet Lao in the Laotian Civil War, the Lao People's Democratic Republic supersedes the Kingdom of Laos. Vientiane remains the capital.
|-
|7 December||style=text-align:left |Indonesia invades East Timor, beginning a twenty-four-year occupation.
|-
|8 December||style=text-align:left |Portugal completely withdraws its forces from East Timor.
|-
|11 December||style=text-align:left |Morocco occupies Laayoune, the capital of Western Sahara, beginning an occupation which continues to the present; fighting immediately breaks out with Polisario Front''' rebels demanding the territory's independence.
|-
|22 December||style=text-align:left |Mauritania conquers La Güera and Tichla after a two-week battle against the Polisario Front, beginning a four-year occupation of the southern part of Western Sahara.
|-
|26 December||style=text-align:left |Iran and Iraq complete the demarcation of their border in the Shatt al-Arab on the basis of the March treaty which resolved their dispute over the waterway.
|-
|30 December||style=text-align:left |Following a referendum, the Malagasy Republic changes its name to the Democratic Republic of Madagascar.
|-
| rowspan=20|1976
|1 January||style=text-align:left |The de facto division of the British Colony of Gilbert and Ellice Islands into the Colony of Gilbert Islands and the Colony of Tuvalu occurs, with the separation of the old administration and introduction of new state symbols.
|-
|5 January||style=text-align:left |Kampuchea changes its name to Democratic Kampuchea.
|-
|8 January||style=text-align:left |The United States annexes the Carranza, Macum, La Oficina, Vado de Pierda, Las Viboras, and Rancho Texas bancos from Mexico under the terms of the Banco Convention of 1905, acquiring 19.9 hectares (49.2 acres).
|-
|26 February||style=text-align:left |Spain completely withdraws its forces and relinquishes its status as the administrative power in Western Sahara.
|-
|27 February||style=text-align:left |The Polisario Front proclaims the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic as an independent state Western Sahara with its capital in Laayoune. 84 UN member states recognize its independence at different times.
|-
|13 March||style=text-align:left |The '''People's Republic of Mozambique changes the name of its capital from Lourenço Marques to Maputo.
|-
|14 April||style=text-align:left |Amidst a war against the Polisario Front, Mauritania and Morocco partition Western Sahara, with Mauritania annexing the southern third as Tiris al-Gharbiyya and Morocco annexing the rest as its Southern Provinces.
|-
|23 June||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom detaches Aldabra, Desroches and the Farquhar Group from the British Indian Ocean Territory and returns the islands to the Seychelles''' days before the latter's independence.
|-
|24 June||style=text-align:left |The Philippines moves its capital from Quezon City back to Manila; the new Metro Manila becomes the official seat of government. Baguio is no longer recognized as the summer capital.
|-
|29 June||style=text-align:left |The Crown Colony of the Seychelles gains independence from the United Kingdom within the Commonwealth of Nations as the Republic of the Seychelles. Victoria remains the capital.
|-
|2 July||style=text-align:left |The Democratic Republic of Vietnam and the Provisional Revolutionary Government of the Republic of South Vietnam unite to form the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. Saigon yields to Hanoi as the capital.
|-
|17 July||style=text-align:left |Indonesia annexes East Timor as the province of East Timor, although much of the mountainous interior remains under the control of the Fretilin resistance movement.
|-
|19 July||style=text-align:left |France incorporates the Overseas Territory of Saint Pierre and Miquelon as the Overseas Department of Saint Pierre and Miquelon.
|-
|1 August||style=text-align:left |Trinidad and Tobago changes its name to the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago and severs all ties to the British monarchy as a Commonwealth realm, but remains in the Commonwealth of Nations.
|-
|9 August||style=text-align:left |The Republic of the North Solomons surrenders to Papua New Guinea in an agreement promising Bougainville Island autonomy as North Solomons Province.
|-
|26 October||style=text-align:left |The Bantustan Republic of Transkei is declared independent by South Africa. Mthatha becomes the capital. No other country recognizes its independence, widely seen as part of the institution of apartheid.
|-
|7 November||style=text-align:left |Argentina occupies Southern Thule in the South Sandwich Islands, territory internationally recognized as part of the United Kingdom.
|-
|4 December||style=text-align:left |The Central African Republic changes its name to the Central African Empire.
|-
|24 December||style=text-align:left |After confirming its decision to break with the Comoros and remain part of France in two referendums held in February and April, Mayotte is reorganized as the Territorial Collectivity of Mayotte.
|-
|28 December||style=text-align:left |The People's Republic of Albania changes its name to the '''People's Socialist Republic of Albania.
|-
| rowspan=10|1977 ||11 February||style=text-align:left |Mayotte moves its capital from Dzaoudzi to Mamoudzou.
|-
|1 March||style=text-align:left |The United States claims maritime borders west of the Strait of Juan de Fuca, within the Dixon Entrance, and in the Beaufort Sea that conflict with the claims of Canada.
|-
|2 March||style=text-align:left |The Libyan Arab Republic changes its name to the Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya.
|-
|31 March||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom officially turns over its military bases in Masirah Island and Salalah to Oman, fulfilling a demand of the United Nations for the UK to end its "colonial policies" in Oman.
|-
|22 May||style=text-align:left |Argentina and Chile turn to the United Kingdom to arbitrate a border dispute over the territorial and maritime borders between them. The United Kingdom recognizes the islands Picton, Nueva and Lennox as Chilean territory as well as the southern half of the Beagle Channel and its islands. The northern half is awarded to Argentina, along with several small islands. The maritime projection of the border defined by the arbitration projects Chile to Antarctica. Due to this, Argentina to declares the result "not valid."
|-
|26 May||style=text-align:left |Mexico and the United States complete the implementation of the Boundary Treaty of 1970, resulting in several parcels of land being swapped.
|-
|27 June||style=text-align:left |Following a referendum, the French Territory of the Afars and the Issas gains independence from France as the Republic of Djibouti. Djibouti City remains the capital.
|-
|13 July||style=text-align:left |Somalia invades Ethiopia, conquering most of the ethnic-Somali region of Ogaden by mid-September
|-
|5 December||style=text-align:left |The Federation of Arab Republics effectively ceases to exist as Libya and Syria dissolve the Federation Presidential Council, though Egypt does not formally withdraw from the confederation until 1 October 1984.
|-
|6 December||style=text-align:left |The Bantustan Republic of Bophuthatswana is declared independent by South Africa. Mmabatho becomes the capital. No other country recognizes its independence, widely seen as part of the institution of apartheid.
|-
| rowspan=9|1978 ||23 March||style=text-align:left |Ethiopia reconquers more than two-thirds of Ogaden, though for several more years Somalia continues to intervene in the region directly and in support of the Western Somali Liberation Front.
|-
|30 April||style=text-align:left |Following the Saur Revolution, the Democratic Republic of Afghanistan supersedes the Republic of Afghanistan. Kabul remains the capital.
|-
|7 July||style=text-align:left |Solomon Islands gains independence from the United Kingdom as a Commonwealth realm. Honiara remains the capital.
|-
|7 September||style=text-align:left |The Free, Sovereign and Independent Republic of Sri Lanka changes its name to the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka.
|-
| rowspan=2|1 October||style=text-align:left |Tuvalu gains independence from the United Kingdom. Funafuti remains the capital.
|-
|style=text-align:left |Following the ratification of a new constitution by referendum, the State of Comoros changes its name to the Federal Islamic Republic of the Comoros.
|-
|3 November||style=text-align:left |The associated state of Dominica gains independence from the United Kingdom as the Commonwealth of Dominica. Roseau remains the capital.
|-
|25 December||style=text-align:left |Vietnam invades Democratic Kampuchea, beginning an occupation of Cambodia lasting more than ten years.
|-
|29 December||style=text-align:left |Following the transition to democracy and the ratification of a new constitution by referendum, the Spanish State changes its name to the Kingdom of Spain.
|-
| rowspan=16|1979 ||7 January||style=text-align:left |Vietnam conquers Phnom Penh effectively overthrowing Democratic Kampuchea, though it remains the UN-recognized government of Cambodia and the Khmer Rouge continues as an insurgency until June 1998.
|-
|8 January||style=text-align:left |The People's Republic of Kampuchea is established by the pro-Vietnamese Salvation Front. Phnom Penh remains the capital of Cambodia.
|-
|11 February||style=text-align:left |Following the overthrow of the Pahlavi dynasty, Iran supersedes the Imperial State of Iran. Tehran remains the capital.
|-
|22 February||style=text-align:left |The associated state of Saint Lucia gains independence from the United Kingdom. Castries remains the capital.
|-
|1 April||style=text-align:left |Following a referendum, Iran changes its name to the Islamic Republic of Iran.
|-
|1 June||style=text-align:left |Rhodesia changes its name to Zimbabwe Rhodesia, implementing an unsuccessful bid for international recognition through a settlement between the white government and moderate African nationalists.
|-
| rowspan=2|12 July||style=text-align:left |The Colony of Gilbert Islands gains independence from the United Kingdom as the Republic of Kiribati; it includes most of the Phoenix and Line Islands claimed by the United States until 1983. South Tarawa remains the capital.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom–United States condominium of Canton and Enderbury Islands is effectively dissolved into Kiribati, as the UK cedes its claims and US forces evacuate the territory ahead of the Treaty of Tarawa.
|-
|5 August||style=text-align:left |Failing to defeat the Sahrawi insurgency despite French support, Mauritania relinquishes all territorial claims in Western Sahara in a peace treaty with the Polisario Front.
|-
|11 August||style=text-align:left |Morocco annexes the southern third of Western Sahara''' following Mauritania's withdrawal. No UN member state has formally recognized Morocco's annexation of any part of Western Sahara.
|-
|13 September||style=text-align:left |The Bantustan Republic of Venda is declared independent by South Africa. Thohoyandou becomes the capital. No other country recognizes its independence, widely seen as part of the institution of apartheid.
|-
|21 September||style=text-align:left |The Central African Empire is overthrown by rebel forces supported by France, and a proclamation is made restoring the Central African Republic.
|-
|1 October||style=text-align:left |The United States dissolves the Panama Canal Zone, transferring its territory to Panama except for 44 US enclaves which will be returned later in stages, and joint control of the canal which continues until 31 December 1999.
|-
|27 October||style=text-align:left |The associated state of Saint Vincent gains independence from the United Kingdom as Saint Vincent and the Grenadines. Kingstown remains the capital.
|-
|11 December||style=text-align:left |Zimbabwe Rhodesia temporarily returns under the rule of the United Kingdom as Southern Rhodesia, implementing the Lancaster House Agreement.
|-
|25 December||style=text-align:left |The Soviet Union invades Afghanistan, overthrowing its government two days later and beginning an occupation lasting more than nine years.

|-
|21 September||style=text-align:left |The Crown Colony of Belize gains independence from the United Kingdom as a Commonwealth realm. Belmopan remains the capital.

|-

|-

|-
| rowspan=14|1982 ||28 January||style=text-align:left |Iraq approves a treaty of 26 December with Saudi Arabia to partition the Neutral Zone between the two. The actual division of the territory occurs thereafter, though the new border is made public only in June 1991.
|-

|-

|-

|-
|18 April||style=text-align:left |Zimbabwe changes the name of its capital from Salisbury to Harare.
|-
|25 April||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom reconquers South Georgia from Argentina.
|-
|26 April||style=text-align:left |Israel completes the sixth and final step of withdrawal, begun on 25 May 1979, from the remaining territory it occupied in the Sinai Peninsula, fulfilling the terms of its March 1979 peace treaty with Egypt.
|-
|29 April||style=text-align:left |Sri Lanka moves its capital from Colombo to Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte.
|-
|30 May||style=text-align:left |Spain joins the North Atlantic Treaty Organization in the alliance's third enlargement.
|-
|14 June||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom reconquers the Falkland Islands from Argentina, ending the Falklands War.
|-
|20 June||style=text-align:left |The United Kingdom reconquers Southern Thule in the South Sandwich Islands from Argentina.
|-
|30 June||style=text-align:left |Iraqi forces are completely expelled from Iran amidst the ongoing Iran–Iraq War.
|-
|15 August||style=text-align:left |The unrecognized Kingdom of Rwenzururu disbands and surrenders to Uganda as part of an agreement promising the region a degree of local autonomy, eventually leading to its revival as a subnational kingdom.
|-

|-

|-

|-

|-
| rowspan=2|23 September||style=text-align:left |The United States removes its claims over Birnie, Canton, Caroline, Christmas, Enderbury, Flint, Gardner, Hull, Malden, McKean, Phoenix, Starbuck, Sydney, and Vostok Islands, ending its territorial dispute with Kiribati.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The United States removes its claims over Funafuti, Niulakita, Nukufetau, and Nukulaelae, ending its territorial dispute with Tuvalu.
|-
|15 November||style=text-align:left |The Turkish Federated State of Cyprus declares independence from Cyprus as the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus. North Nicosia remains the capital. Only Turkey, which occupies Northern Cyprus, recognizes it.
|-
| rowspan=5|1984 ||1 January||style=text-align:left |The Brunei Darussalam (Nation of Brunei, the Abode of Peace) gains independence within the Commonwealth of Nations from the United Kingdom.
|-

|-

|28 July||style=text-align:left |Vietnam joins ASEAN as the association's seventh member state.
|-
| rowspan=2|7 August||style=text-align:left |Croatian and Bosnian forces reconquer most of Serbian Krajina.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The Republic of Western Bosnia is conquered by the forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina supported by Croatia.
|-
|21 August||style=text-align:left |Ethiopia changes its name to the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia with the promulgation of a new constitution.
|-
|24 August||style=text-align:left |The Republic of Georgia changes its name to Georgia.
|-
|28 September|| style="text-align:left" |The Oslo II Accord begins the transfer of land to the Palestinian Authority. All of the Gaza Strip and 18% of the West Bank is eventually transferred to full Palestinian control, and 22% to joint Israeli-Palestinian control.
|-
|14 October||style=text-align:left |Ukraine officially changes the English name of its capital from Kiev to Kyiv.
|-
|12 November||style=text-align:left |Croatia and the remaining portion of Serbian Krajina in Eastern Slavonia, Baranja and Western Syrmia reach an agreement to reincorporate the region into Croatia through a transitional United Nations protectorate.
|-
|14 December||style=text-align:left |The Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and Republika Srpska unite to form Bosnia and Herzegovina, superseding the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Sarajevo remains the capital.
|-
| rowspan=4|1996 ||15 January||style=text-align:left |The United Nations Transitional Administration for Eastern Slavonia, Baranja and Western Sirmium is established in the remaining territory of the former Serbian Krajina in order to reintegrate the region into Croatia.
|-
|February||style=text-align:left |Tanzania moves its capital from Dar es Salaam to Dodoma.
|-
|rowspan=2 |27 September||style=text-align:left |The Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan is established following the Taliban's conquest of Kabul, which becomes the state capital.
|-
|style=text-align:left |The Islamic State of Afghanistan moves its de facto capital to Mazar-i-Sharif following the evacuation of Kabul.
|-
| rowspan=11|1997 ||23 January||style=text-align:left |The Chechen Republic of Ichkeria changes the name of its capital from Grozny to Dzokhar-Ghala.
|-
|17 May||style=text-align:left |The Republic of Zaire changes its name back to the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
|-
|25 May||style=text-align:left |The Islamic State of Afghanistan moves its capital from Mazar-i-Sharif to Taloqan, as Mazar-i-Sharif becomes a battlefield in the war against the Taliban.
|-
|28 May||style=text-align:left |Ukraine formally agrees to lease naval facilities in Sevastopol to Russia for twenty years, until 2017.
|-
|1 July||style=text-align:left |Sovereignty over Hong Kong is transferred to China from the United Kingdom. Hong Kong becomes a special administrative region.
|-
|4 July||style=text-align:left |The Independent State of Western Samoa changes its name to the Independent State of Samoa.
|-
|23 July||style=text-align:left |Laos and Myanmar join ASEAN as the association's eighth and ninth member states.
|-
|27 July||style=text-align:left |The Sovereign Democratic Republic of Fiji changes its name to the Republic of the Fiji Islands upon the promulgation of a new constitution. Fiji returns to its membership of the Commonwealth of Nations as a result.
|-
|3 August||style=text-align:left |The State of Anjouan declares independence from the Comoros. Mutsamudu becomes the capital.
|-
|11 August||style=text-align:left |The Democratic Republic of Mohéli declares independence from the Comoros. Fomboni becomes the capital.
|-
|10 December||style=text-align:left |Kazakhstan moves its capital from Almaty to Aqmola.
|-
| rowspan=6|1998 ||15 January||style=text-align:left |The United Nations Transitional Administration for Eastern Slavonia, Baranja and Western Sirmium concludes its operations and transfers full administrative authority over the region to Croatia.
|-
|6 May||style=text-align:left |Kazakhstan changes the name of its capital from Aqmola to Astana.
|-
|(Unknown)||style=text-align:left |Comoros reabsorbs the de facto independent Democratic Republic of Mohéli. Fomboni yields to Moroni as the capital.
|-
|4 July||style=text-align:left |China is allocated 407 km2 and Kazakhstan is allocated 537 km2 of disputed territory in a treaty delimiting the border between the two countries.
|-
|1 August||style=text-align:left |The Puntland State of Somalia declares "temporary" independence from Somalia. Garowe becomes the capital.
|-
|16 December||style=text-align:left |Argentina and Chile redraw part of the border in the Southern Patagonian Ice Field, and establish a pending of definition area between Mount Fitz Roy and Cerro Murallón.
|-
| rowspan="13" |1999
|5 March||style=text-align:left |Self-governing Brčko District in Bosnia and Herzegovina is established.
|-
|12 March||style=text-align:left |The Czech Republic, Hungary, and Poland join the North Atlantic Treaty Organization in the alliance's fourth enlargement.
|-
|19 March|| style="text-align:left" |France elevates the Overseas Territory of New Caledonia to the 'sui generis collectivity of New Caledonia.
|-
|2 April||style=text-align:left |Azerbaijan, Georgia, and Uzbekistan leave the Collective Security Treaty Organization. The remaining six members renew the treaty for another 5 years.
|-
|30 April||style=text-align:left |Cambodia joins ASEAN' as the association's tenth member state.
|-
|10 June||style=text-align:left |The United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo is formed in the Autonomous Province of Kosovo and Metohija of Yugoslavia.
|-
|20 June||style=text-align:left |The last forces of Yugoslavia withdraw from Kosovo.
|-
|23 June||style=text-align:left |Belgium and The Netherlands make a small change to the border at the Ghent–Terneuzen Canal.
|-
|25 October||style=text-align:left |Indonesia relinquishes control over the disputed region of East Timor to the United Nations Transitional Administration in East Timor.
|-
|rowspan=2 |20 December||style=text-align:left |The Republic of Venezuela changes its name to the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela.
|-
|style=text-align:left |Sovereignty over Macau is transferred to China from Portugal. Macau becomes a special administrative region.
|-
|30 December||style=text-align:left |China and Vietnam sign a treaty resolving their border dispute, with China acquiring 114 km2 and Vietnam acquiring 113 km2 of disputed territory.
|-
|31 December||style=text-align:left |The United States transfers the operation of the Panama Canal and full sovereignty in the former Panama Canal Zone to Panama.
